title.narrative: Basket Support to REPOA Strategic Plan 2015-2019
Basket Support to REPOA Strategic Plan 2015-2019

description.narrative:
REPOA har ansökt om 4 miljoner kronor för att genomföra de första två åren av sin strategiska plan (2015-2019). Den sammanlagda preliminära budgeten för 2015-2016 är 18.5 miljarder TSH, motsvarande ca 84 miljoner kronor.
För 2015 är 2.28 miljarder TSH, motsvarande 29% av de nödvändiga ekonomiska resurserna, utlovade av REPOAs externa givare. För övriga intäkter (71%) kommer REPOA att genomföra externt finansierade uppdrag och studier som ligger i linje med REPOAs strategiska inriktning.
Givare som utlovat stöd är bland annat Danmark, DFID och Norge. Danmark kommer att fördela totalt 500,000 dollar (ungefär 1 miljard Tsh) för en tvåårsperiod, fördelat på 250.000 dollar som basfinansiering och 250,000 dollar ytterligare som tematisk finansiering.
REPOA är registrerat som ett icke-vinstdrivande företag vars vision är att vara en ledande forskningsinstitution i Tanzania och att bidra till kunskap i syfte att bidra till förbättrade levnadsvillkor för människor i Tanzania.
Under de kommande fem åren, syftar REPOAs verksamhet till:
I. Stärka kapaciteten av intellektuella resurser (producenter och användare av kunskap), II. Genomföra, underlätta och uppmuntra strategisk forskning för att påverka politiskt beslutstagande, och III. Underlätta och inspirera för olika aktörer att utnyttja forskningsresultat.
Under denna två-årsperiod kommer REPOA att fokusera på forskning inom tre tematiska områden: allmän resursmobilisering och finasiell styrning; lokal utveckling och basservice; samt samhällstyrning och landresurser.

REPOA has applied to Sida for SEK 4 million to implement the first two years of its strategic plan (2015-2019). The total estimated budget for 2015-2016 is TZS Bn18.5, equivalent to approximately MSEK 84. For 2015, it is expected that TZS 2.28Bn or 29 % of the required financial resources will come from Development Partners through the basket arrangement. The rest (71%) of the budget will come from other sources that include the current collaborative work and commissioned studies which are aligned to REPOA’s strategic focus. UPDATE - Amendement in 2018, new support totalling MSEK 13.2 through 2019.
Donors who have indicated willingness to support include Denmark, DFID and Norway. Denmark will allocate a total of USD 500,000 for the two-year period, split in two i.e. USD 250,000 core funding and USD 250,000 additional thematic/collaborative funding.
REPOA is a not-for-profit company whose Vision is to be a leading research institution in the production of knowledge that will contribute to improving the lives of people in Tanzania. Its Mission is to facilitate and undertake research, training and outreach.
During the next five years, REPOA seeks to: I. Strengthen the capacity of the intellectual resource (producers and users of knowledge), II. Undertake, facilitate and encourage strategic research to influence policy, and III. Facilitate and inspire stakeholders to utilize research findings.
During the period REPOA will focus more on existing research in strategic policy areas of Growth and Development, Social Protection and Governance and Service Delivery in order to generate knowledge aimed at improving quality of policies and policy design, policy implementation, accountability and democratic engagement of citizens, and hence quality of lives.

participating-org.narrative: Sida administrative activity implemented by procured partner

tag.narrative: 1.b - Create sound policy frameworks at the national, regional and international levels, based on pro-poor and gender-sensitive development strategies, to support accelerated investment in poverty eradication actions.

1.b - Upprätta sunda policyramverk på nationell, regional och internationell nivå på grundval av utvecklingsstrategier som stödjer de fattiga och tar hänsyn till jämställdhetsaspekter, för att stödja ökade investeringar i åtgärder för att avskaffa fattigdom.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During the strategic period, REPOA implemented various research projects and support activities to fulfil its mission and strive to reach its vision. For the year ended December 2018, REPOA implemented 18 of a planned 22 research projects. REPOA continued to strengthen its resolve to generate knowledge for better policy results. During the year, this was done by increased rigour in conducting policy, contextually relevant and original research; disseminating and promoting the use of research findings; creating spaces for enhanced dialogue involving research, academia, policy and the citizenry; and training of researchers and research users. An example is the Growth and Economic Opportunities for Women (GrOW) project which is implemented over a three-year period. The project delved into examining the impact of Tanzania Social Action Fund (TASAF) programme on women economic empowerment in Tanzania. Findings showed that while TASAF was able to empower women on tasks within the sphere of its conditional cash transfers, that empowerment could not be translated broadly into women empowerment in areas outside TASAF domain. Findings further indicated that qualitative factors such as religion, culture and the law had a big (negative) impact on the status of women empowerment in Tanzania, suggesting a need to supplement TASAF programme with relevant programmes and actions that would truly help emancipate women economically. To a large extent, this project was completed, but it was carried forward in the 2019 financial year to produce two further briefs. Moreover, the closing workshop was be delivered in Dodoma by early 2019 where the Swedish Ambassador give a speech as Sweden supports both REPOA and TASAF through the Feminist Foreign Policy.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
